shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 3ra-18vb) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 19ra-49rb) III) Anaphoras (fols. 49ra-135va) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 49ra-59va) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 59va-61vb) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 61vb-70rb) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, Son of Thunder (fols. 70rb-77vb) III-5) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 77vb-80rb) III-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 80va-89rb) III-7) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 89rb-96ra) III-8) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 96rb-102vb) III-9) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 103ra-109rb) III-10) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 109va-115rb) III-11) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 115va-122ra) III-12) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 122ra-127rb) III-13) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 127rb-129rb) III-14) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 129rb-135va) IV) Creed of the Apostles (fols. 135va-136rb). (see "Other details")
Additiones 1-3.

dcomments.dcomment: King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913) is mentioned on fols. 14va, 14vb, 92rb.

txstates.txstate: The leather cover is damaged. The sewing is damaged and crudely repaired with synthetic threads. Some fols. are damaged by water (esp. fols. 1-10. Some fols. are very worn (esp. fols. 28-37), many are discoloured.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 were used: criss-cross, double sine wave with dots, triple sine wave, corni-form, triple line fillet, double circle).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head, one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(10/fols. 11r-20v) – III(10/fols. 21r-30v) – IV(8/fols. 31r-38v) – V(8/fols. 39r-46v) – VI(8/fols. 47r-54v) – VII(8/fols. 55r-62v) – VIII(10/fols. 63r-72v) – ፱IX(10/s. l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 73r-82v) – ፲X(10/fols. 83r-92v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 93r-100v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 101r-110v) – ፲፫XIII(10/fols. 111r-120v) – XIV(10/fols. 121r-130v) – ፲፭XV(6/fols. 131r-136v)

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 9r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 3r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the King; incipits and headings of the texts; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; abbreviations; the word ʾǝgäle in supplication formulas (s. fol. 27rb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. On the incipit page of Texts I, II and III (fols. 3r, 19r, 49r), few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅ(ዱ)፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ተሣ፡ for (እግዚኦ፡) ተሣሀለነ፡ (s. fol. 13va)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Text IV is designated as ዘተረስአ፡ “that which was omitted” (fol. 135va, l.4). This creed is used only in the Anaphora of the Apostles, therefore its proper place is within Text III-1. - Text IV is written in smaller script than Texts I-III.

additional.cont: Fol. 1v: Extensive unidentified note.
additional.det: In Amharic. Crudely written in violet ink. The note contains many names of clerics as well as Ethiopic numbers. The note probably assigns to each of the deacons and priests mentioned their turns in celebrating the Mass.

additional.cont: Fol. 2v: Unidentified note.
additional.det: In Amharic. Crudely written in violet ink. The note contains names of priests as well as designations of their turns in celebrating the Mass (?) in European numbers. The name of the fourth priest has been crossed out.

additional.cont: Fol. 136rb: Unidentified note.
additional.det: In Amharic. Crudely written, most of the words are poorly visible. The note orobably contains information concerning a litigation (the word ዋስ is clearly legible).

extras.extra: - Crude notes written in the bottom margin: fols. 4r, 57r, 130r. - Crude note written in the upper margin: fol. 107r. - Crude note containing the name of ḥaläqa Gäbrä ʾIyäsus: fol. 136v..

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Most of the quires either lack numbering or their numbers are poorly visible.

miniature.info: Fol. 2r: Prophet Elijah receiving food from a raven (?).
Fol. 80rb: St. Mary breastfeeding the Child Jesus.
Fol. 115rb: Winged angel with a sword.

drawing.details: Crude drawing of a cross. Another object, difficult to recognize, is drawn to the left.
